snippet: A long-running economic policy debate over austerity versus stimulus was expected to be muted at the Group of 8 summit as participants concentrated on addressing the escalating civil war in Syria.
abstract: Long-running economic policy debate over austerity versus stimulus is expected to be muted at Group of 8 summit; participants are expected to concentrate on addressing intensifying debate on whether and how to intervene in escalating civil war in Syria.

byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins and Stephen Castle contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A long-running economic policy debate over austerity versus stimulus was expected to be muted at the Group of 8 summit as participants concentrated on addressing the escalating civil war in Syria.

headline.main: Lines Blur in U.S.-Europe Debate on Austerity
headline.print_headline: Lines Blur in U.S.-Europe Debate on Austerity
